FC Barcelona and PAOK FC have reached an agreement for the loan of the player Moussa Wague for the 2020/21 season. The Greek club will take over the player's contract.

Moussa Wague made his debut for the first team on 13 April 2019 in a league game against Huesca. The Senegalese international has played six games with the first team: four in the league and two in the Champions League. In Europe he made his debut in the closing minutes of a game against Borussia Dortmund and then featured against Inter Milan as well. Wague was part of the Barça squad that won the league in 2018/19 and he spent the second half of the 2019/20 season on loan at French club Nice.

"I've said my side,” Rakitic told El Desmarque. “My relationship with them was never one of close friends. I believe that's hard in a group of 23 or 24 players.

“My closest friends were Andres Iniesta, [Marc-Andre] ter Stegen, [Kevin-Prince] Boateng and Junior Firpo last season.

“But I respect them both. They were my team-mates for six years and are very important players. I've always got on incredibly well and have the utmost respect for them.

“During the coronavirus lockdown, we've all been very close together, almost neighbours. I'm very thankful for how they've treated me over the years."

ğŸ—£ | Sergi Roberto's full interview with RAC1 -
About the defeat against Bayern :
"The defeat against Bayern is hard to forget. It has been a very hard blow for everyone and we have had the worst summer. At that point you don’t even want to play football again."
About his stay at Barça :
"I would like to go to the US in the last years of my career. Barça is the club of my life and while I'm competing in Europe, I would like to be at Barça, but I would like to live an experience like going to MLS."
About the Messi situation :
"I thought the same as all the Catalans, that it could not be true that Messi did not want to continue with us. I can't imagine a Barça without Leo and he crossed his fingers for him to stay."
"I see him training really well. He is a very professional player and I have no doubt that he will always give 100% for this shirt and this club."
About Riqui Puig :
"I was in a similar situation back in the day. The season is long and there will be many chances. If he wants to succeed at Barça he has to stay and take every opportunity he gets."
About Koeman :
"He has made us work a lot, the workouts have been very long. We are working very well. I see him very well prepared both tactically and, he tells the players things clearly and that’s good for the team. I fully trust the coach and all the players."

Suárez: "I'm a Culer forever."

Luis Suárez, on his farewell:
His introductory speech:
"It is all unforeseen. I have nothing prepared. I can only thank the Club for having trusted me knowing where I came from because of a mistake I had made."
"People know the effort I have always made to be able to play for the best team in the world. I have to be proud of everything I did and for the friends I have made along the way. My family, has really enjoyed the good and the bad, they have supported me much more because they know the suffering we live in but I like to keep the beauty we live in. Lifting titles, scoring, playing alongside great players and playing alongside the best player in history.
"I want to thank the fans for all the love they have given me. They encouraged me till the last day. I also thank the staff who work with us every day.They will have a cule forever, no matter where I go."
On his time at Barça:
"It was seeing a dream come true, but I never imagined reaching these figures. You must always perform at your best here and you don't know how many years you can be here for. I am more than proud and satisfied with some spectacular and wonderful years at Barça."
"I have lived many moments here, trophies and bad moments too, but I stay more with the first. Winning La Liga and the Champions League, scoring goals, playing with wonderful players that I saw on PlayStation. Then, the farewell ... Each player has his way of getting lost and living. I keep it to myself and having my colleagues and my family here is what I keep."
"My farewell is a subject that I have already assimilated, I have already digested it. I must now look forward to the future. I can leave proud and satisfied after these six wonderful years that I have lived here. I have not yet imagined what it will be like to face Barça, against former teammates and friends ... but we will try to make a nice game."
On the past month and the debacle surrounding the club:
"It was a crazy month. To also say things that one did not think. Things have been invented, things that are not true have been leaked and that is unworthy, but you must stay away from everything. Everyone knows the relationship I share with Leo Messi. When I arrived they said 'be careful with Leo, he's a forward'. And I'm a forward too and they said it was bad for me. I have to go proud."
On his departure from the club:
"Of course I thought I could continue here ... this last year leaves me a bittersweet taste due to injuries. I'm leaving to continue competing."
"As much as one has a contract, the club and the player needs changes. In this case it was that the coach did not count on me. I leave thinking that I have met expectations, as the third scorer in history and happy to leave a beautiful mark and will be remembered for everything I did in good times and bad, there were also times where you have to be self-critical."
"When the coach communicated it to me, I was already expecting it because it had already been said before in the newspaper reports. But I can accept it, I have a contract and I will continue training until I get a solution as a professional that I am. The coach had no problems."
On Leo Messi:
"What has Messi told me about going to Atlético? No, it is a strange thing because I am going, first, and also to a direct rival. But we already face between Argentina and Uruguay. That will not affect the personal relationship we have."
"Was that a message to the club? It was in a joking tone. I am not going to please anyone. I want to leave as the great Barça player that I was."

replies.msg:
Trincão: "Have I spoke to Messi? Yes, of course, he asked me how I was doing, if I was okay and if I needed anything, and during the matches he comments on the game and gives me directions."

"I love scoring and assisting, looking for one on one continuously and helping the team with the ball and without the ball."

"Koeman talks to me a lot and what he asks me most is that I be myself, that I try to score goals. I am a young player who still has to improve in all aspects, who has to analyze his games and who has to see what he is doing well and what he is doing wrong to evolve."

"I don't watch other teams' games, I don't like it, I only watch my team's games."

"I love the number 17, it's my dad's birthday. I was the European Under-19 champion also with 17 and it is a number that I have affection for. My first goal will be for him."

"My references? In football there are many players that I like but if I have to name some, I would stay with Cristiano and Messi. They are the best."

"Where do I see myself in 5 years? I see myself as a reference at Barça. That is my goal."
